summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 regarding the handling and transfer of hard drives containing discovery materials for the US v. Epstein case, specifically the final discovery production for Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses the stamping, export, and review process of electronic documents by a vendor, and coordination between legal staff for physical transfer.

persons.name: Phifer
persons.context: Person to whom the hard drives containing discovery productions should be sent, at the address '1St Andrews'.

events.title: Instruction to send hard drives to Phifer
events.description: An email instructs that all productions (production 15 & 16) copied to hard drives be sent to Phifer at 1St Andrews.

events.title: Coordination for drive review
events.description: Email exchange confirms receipt of two hard drives from PAE, plans for review and spot-checking of the final discovery production for Maxwell on the following Monday.

keyFacts: The document concerns the final discovery production for Ghislaine Maxwell in the US v. Epstein case.
Hard drives containing productions 15 and 16 were prepared and required physical transfer to an individual named Phifer.
A vendor was used to stamp and export electronic discovery documents, breaking the production into seven parts.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal preparation and coordination between prosecution/defense teams and support staff in November 2020.
The email chain shows logistical planning for evidence handling and review ahead of potential court deadlines.
